title: Fix: Replace bcrypt with bcryptjs (Docker compatibility)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Node containers crash with 'Exec format error' on bcrypt native module.

Cause: bcrypt binary compiled on macOS (ARM64) doesn't work in Linux Docker containers.

Fix:
1. Replace 'bcrypt' with 'bcryptjs' in auth-service and token-service package.json
2. Update imports: const bcrypt = require('bcryptjs') instead of require('bcrypt')
3. API is identical, no code changes needed beyond import

bcryptjs is pure JavaScript - works everywhere without native compilation.

title: Enhancement: Dockerize full build process
description:
Build everything inside Docker to avoid host/container architecture mismatches.

Create docker-build.sh or update build.sh to:
1. Use multi-stage Docker builds
2. npm install runs inside Linux container (not on host)
3. Python deps installed in container
4. Frontend builds run in container
5. Output: ready-to-run Docker images

Benefits:
- No host dependency issues (bcrypt, etc.)
- Deterministic builds regardless of host OS
- Works on Mac ARM64, Intel, Linux equally

title: Fix: Change postgres:// to postgresql:// for SQLAlchemy 2.x
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Python services crash with 'Can't load plugin: sqlalchemy.dialects:postgres'

SQLAlchemy 2.x removed the 'postgres' alias - must use 'postgresql'.

Fix:
1. Update .env.example DATABASE_URL to use postgresql://
2. Update Python service database.py files to handle both or enforce postgresql://
3. Update docker-compose.yml if it sets DATABASE_URL

title: Fix: Rename 'metadata' column in analytics models (SQLAlchemy reserved)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

analytics-service crashes: 'Attribute name metadata is reserved when using Declarative API'

SQLAlchemy uses 'metadata' internally. Rename to 'extra_data' or 'meta_info' in models.py
